Change the DTD description in to reference the Combined HTML MathML entity set rather than the legacy ISO entity sets. div2.head: Changes between MathML 2.0 Second Edition and MathML 3.0

item.p: Changes to .
The attribute href added to the common MathML attributes, to allow hypertext links.
Additional attributes added to the math element, see .
Changes to .
Introduced mechanisms for controlling the Directionality of layout, as described in .
Introduced mechanisms for controlling linebreaking .
Extended mglyph to support general image inclusion, .
The facilities for adjusting spacing with mpadded have been extended and rationalised, .
Introduced new presentation elements for elementary math layouts, : mstack, mlongdiv, msgroup, msrow, mscarries, mscarry, and msline.
Changes to .
Introduced new content elements bind, share, cerror, cs and cbytes.
Removed deprecated content elements reln and fn.
Removed content element declare.
The concept of Strict Content MathML and the use of OpenMath Content Dictionaries has been introduced, and the whole chapter restructured.
Changes to .
New Chapter: .
Changes to .
This chapter is much reduced from the corresponding chapter in previous releases of MathML. All the tables and much of the other content of this chapter is now maintained as a separate document
Changes to .
The Normative version of the grammar is now expressed in Relax NG, with DTD and XSD versions being derived.

Three MathML 1 attrbutes on math that were deprecated and undocumented in MathML2 but retained in the MathML2 DTD have been removed. name (use id instead), baseline and type (These are not used by any known implementation, so can be removed.) See Chapter 7 of .
New Appendix: .
Changes to .
The Operator Dictionary table has been updated and rationalised and presented in a new format.
MathML DOM
The chapter and appendices relating to the MathML DOM have been removed from this specification, with the intention of updating them and publishing them as a separate document at a later time.
